questions.question: I have heard this …………………
questions.description: Before can mean at any time before now/then.

questions.question: I haven’t heard anything from him ………………….
He called me a few minutes ……………………..
questions.description: Ago is used with a past tense and a time expression to count back from the present.

questions.question: He once met me in Egypt. I have not seen him …………………..
questions.description: We use since to reckon from a point of time in the past.

questions.question: That day he arrived ………………………
questions.description: Late is the opposite of early.

questions.question: He ……………………. to do his best.
questions.description: Adverbs of frequency usually go after the modal auxiliary verb and before other verbs.

questions.question: He …………………….. mistakes.
questions.description: Adverbs of frequency usually go after the modal auxiliary verb and before other verbs.

questions.question: The patient is …………………… worse today.
questions.description: Worse is the comparative form of bad. We use much to modify comparative adjectives. More is not possible here.

questions.question: Ambition urged me …………………..
questions.description: Forward and forwards are both correct as adverbs.

questions.question: The reason …………………….. I came here was to be with my family.
